54 #include <complex>
55 #include <ext/math_const.h>
56 #include <vector>

58 namespace std _GLIBCXX_VISIBILITY(default)
59 {
60 _GLIBCXX_BEGIN_NAMESPACE_VERSION
61 
62 // Implementation-space details.
63 namespace __detail
64 {
65  /**
66  * @brief Return the Legendre polynomial by upward recursion
67  * on degree @f$ l @f$.
68  *
69  * The Legendre function of degree @f$ l @f$ and argument @f$ x @f$,
70  * @f$ P_l(x) @f$, is defined by:
71  * @f[
72  * P_l(x) = \frac{1}{2^l l!}\frac{d^l}{dx^l}(x^2 - 1)^{l}
73  * @f]
74  * This can be expressed as a series:
75  * @f[
76  * P_l(x) = \frac{1}{2^l l!}\sum_{k=0}^{\lfloor l/2 \rfloor}
77  * \frac{(-1)^k(2l-2k)!}{k!(l-k)!(l-2k)!}x^{l-2k}
78  * @f]
79  *
80  * @param __l The degree of the Legendre polynomial. @f$ l >= 0 @f$.
81  * @param __x The argument of the Legendre polynomial.
82  */
83  template<typename _Tp>
84  __gnu_cxx::__legendre_p_t<_Tp>
85  __legendre_p(unsigned int __l, _Tp __x)
86  {
87  using _Real = __num_traits_t<_Tp>;
88  using __ret_t = __gnu_cxx::__legendre_p_t<_Tp>;
89 
90  const auto __lge1 = __l >= 1 ? _Tp{+1} : _Tp{0};
91  const auto __lge2 = __l >= 2 ? _Tp{+1} : _Tp{0};
92  const auto _S_NaN = __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(_Real{});
93 
94  if (std::isnan(__x))
95  return {__l, _S_NaN, _S_NaN, _S_NaN, _S_NaN};
96  else if (__x == _Real{+1})
97  return {__l, __x, _Tp{+1}, __lge1, __lge2};
98  else if (__x == _Real{-1})
99  return __l % 2 == 1
100  ? __ret_t{__l, __x, _Tp{-1}, +__lge1, -__lge2}
101  : __ret_t{__l, __x, _Tp{+1}, -__lge1, +__lge2};
102  else
103  {
104  auto _P_lm2 = _Tp{1};
105  if (__l == 0)
106  return {__l, __x, _P_lm2, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}};
107 
108  auto _P_lm1 = __x;
109  if (__l == 1)
110  return {__l, __x, _P_lm1, _P_lm2, _Tp{0}};
111 
112  auto _P_l = _Tp{2} * __x * _P_lm1 - _P_lm2
113  - (__x * _P_lm1 - _P_lm2) / _Tp{2};
114  for (unsigned int __ll = 3; __ll <= __l; ++__ll)
115  {
116  _P_lm2 = _P_lm1;
117  _P_lm1 = _P_l;
118  // This arrangement is supposed to be better for roundoff
119  // protection, Arfken, 2nd Ed, Eq 12.17a.
120  _P_l = _Tp{2} * __x * _P_lm1 - _P_lm2
121  - (__x * _P_lm1 - _P_lm2) / _Tp(__ll);
122  }
123 
124  return {__l, __x, _P_l, _P_lm1, _P_lm2};
125  }
126  }
127 
128  /**
129  * Legendre q series.
130  */
131  template<typename _Tp>
132  _Tp
133  __legendre_q_series(unsigned int __l, _Tp __x)
134  {
135  const auto __num1 = _Tp(__l + 1) / _Tp{2};
136  const auto __num2 = _Tp(__l + 2) / _Tp{2};
137  const auto __den = _Tp(2 * __l + 3) / _Tp{2};
138  const auto __rx = _Tp{1} / __x;
139  const auto __rx2 = __rx * __rx;
140 
141  const auto __sum = std::__detail::__hyperg(__num1, __num2, __den, __rx2);
142 
143  auto __fact = __rx;
144  for (int __k = 1; __k <= __l; ++__k)
145  __fact *= _Tp(__k) * __rx / _Tp(2 * __k - 1);
146 
147  return __fact * __sum;
148  }
149 
150  /**
151  * @brief Return the Legendre function of the second kind
152  * by upward recursion on degree @f$ l @f$.
153  *
154  * The Legendre function of the second kind of degree @f$ l @f$
155  * and argument @f$ x @f$, @f$ Q_l(x) @f$, is defined by:
156  * @f[
157  * Q_l(x) = \frac{1}{2^l l!}\frac{d^l}{dx^l}(x^2 - 1)^{l}
158  * @f]
159  *
160  * @param __l The degree of the Legendre function. @f$ l >= 0 @f$.
161  * @param __x The argument of the Legendre function. @f$ |x| <= 1 @f$.
162  */
163  template<typename _Tp>
164  __gnu_cxx::__legendre_q_t<_Tp>
165  __legendre_q(unsigned int __l, _Tp __x)
166  {
167  using _Real = __num_traits_t<_Tp>;
168  const auto _S_eps = __gnu_cxx::__epsilon(_Real{});
169  const auto _S_inf = __gnu_cxx::__infinity(_Real{});
170  if (std::isnan(__x))
171  {
172  const auto _S_NaN = __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(_Real{});
173  return {__l, __x, _S_NaN, _S_NaN, _S_NaN};
174  }
175  else if (std::abs(__x - _Real{1}) < _S_eps)
176  return {__l, __x, _S_inf, _S_inf, _S_inf};
177  else if (std::abs(__x + _Real{1}) < _S_eps)
178  {
179  const auto __sgn = (__l & 1 ? +1 : -1);
180  return {__l, __x, __sgn * _S_inf, -__sgn * _S_inf, __sgn * _S_inf};
181  }
182  else if (std::abs(__x) < _Real{1})
183  {
184  auto _Q_lm2 = _Tp{0.5L} * std::log((_Tp{1} + __x) / (_Tp{1} - __x));
185  if (__l == 0)
186  return {__l, __x, _Q_lm2, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}};
187  auto _Q_lm1 = __x * _Q_lm2 - _Tp{1};
188  if (__l == 1)
189  return {__l, __x, _Q_lm1, _Q_lm2, _Tp{0}};
190  auto _Q_l = _Tp{2} * __x * _Q_lm1 - _Q_lm2
191  - (__x * _Q_lm1 - _Q_lm2) / _Tp{2};
192  for (unsigned int __ll = 3; __ll <= __l; ++__ll)
193  {
194  _Q_lm2 = _Q_lm1;
195  _Q_lm1 = _Q_l;
196  // This arrangement is supposed to be better for roundoff
197  // protection, Arfken, 2nd Ed, Eq 12.17a.
198  // Is this still true for Q?
199  _Q_l = _Tp{2} * __x * _Q_lm1 - _Q_lm2
200  - (__x * _Q_lm1 - _Q_lm2) / _Tp(__ll);
201  }
202 
203  return {__l, __x, _Q_l, _Q_lm1, _Q_lm2};
204  }
205  else
206  {
207  const auto _Q_l = __legendre_q_series(__l, __x);
208  if (__l == 0)
209  return {__l, __x, _Q_l, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}};
210  const auto _Q_lm1 = __legendre_q_series(__l - 1, __x);
211  if (__l == 1)
212  return {__l, __x, _Q_l, _Q_lm1, _Tp{0}};
213  const auto _Q_lm2 = (_Tp(2 * __l - 1) * __x * _Q_lm1
214  - _Tp(__l) * _Q_l) / _Tp(__l - 1);
215  return {__l, __x, _Q_l, _Q_lm1, _Q_lm2};
216  }
217  }
218 
219  /**
220  * @brief Return the associated Legendre function by recursion
221  * on @f$ l @f$ and downward recursion on m.
222  *
223  * The associated Legendre function is derived from the Legendre function
224  * @f$ P_l(x) @f$ by the Rodrigues formula:
225  * @f[
226  * P_l^m(x) = (1 - x^2)^{m/2}\frac{d^m}{dx^m}P_l(x)
227  * @f]
228  * @note The Condon-Shortley phase factor @f$ (-1)^m @f$ is absent
229  * by default.
230  * @note @f$ P_l^m(x) = 0 @f$ if @f$ m > l @f$.
231  *
232  * @param __l The degree of the associated Legendre function.
233  * @f$ l >= 0 @f$.
234  * @param __m The order of the associated Legendre function.
235  * @param __x The argument of the associated Legendre function.
236  * @param __phase The phase of the associated Legendre function.
237  * Use -1 for the Condon-Shortley phase convention.
238  */
239  template<typename _Tp>
240  __gnu_cxx::__assoc_legendre_p_t<_Tp>
241  __assoc_legendre_p(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, _Tp __x,
242  _Tp __phase = _Tp{+1})
243  {
244  using _Real = __num_traits_t<_Tp>;
245  if (__m > __l)
246  return {__l, __m, __x, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}};
247  else if (std::isnan(__x))
248  {
249  const auto _NaN = __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(_Real{});
250  return {__l, __m, __x, _NaN, _NaN, _NaN, __phase};
251  }
252  else if (__m == 0)
253  {
254  const auto _P_l = __legendre_p(__l, __x);
255  return {__l, __m, __x, _P_l.__P_l, _P_l.__P_lm1, _P_l.__P_lm2,
256  __phase};
257  }
258  else
259  {
260  auto _P_mm = _Tp{1};
261  if (__m > 0)
262  {
263  // Two square roots seem more accurate more of the time
264  // than just one.
265  auto __root = std::sqrt(_Tp{1} - __x) * std::sqrt(_Tp{1} + __x);
266  auto __fact = _Tp{1};
267  for (unsigned int __i = 1; __i <= __m; ++__i)
268  {
269  // N. B. Condon-Shortley would use __phase = -1 here.
270  _P_mm *= __phase * __fact * __root;
271  __fact += _Tp{2};
272  }
273  }
274  if (__l == __m)
275  return {__l, __m, __x, _P_mm, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, __phase};
276 
277  auto _P_mp1m = _Tp(2 * __m + 1) * __x * _P_mm;
278  if (__l == __m + 1)
279  return {__l, __m, __x, _P_mp1m, _P_mm, _Tp{0}, __phase};
280 
281  auto _P_lm2m = _P_mm;
282  auto _P_lm1m = _P_mp1m;
283  auto _P_lm = (_Tp(2 * __m + 3) * __x * _P_lm1m
284  - _Tp(2 * __m + 1) * _P_lm2m) / _Tp{2};
285  for (unsigned int __j = __m + 3; __j <= __l; ++__j)
286  {
287  _P_lm2m = _P_lm1m;
288  _P_lm1m = _P_lm;
289  _P_lm = (_Tp(2 * __j - 1) * __x * _P_lm1m
290  - _Tp(__j + __m - 1) * _P_lm2m) / _Tp(__j - __m);
291  }
292 
293  return {__l, __m, __x, _P_lm, _P_lm1m, _P_lm2m};
294  }
295  }
296 
297  template<typename _Tp>
298  __gnu_cxx::__assoc_legendre_q_t<_Tp>
299  __assoc_legendre_q(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, _Tp __x,
300  _Tp __phase = _Tp{+1})
301  {
302  using _Real = __num_traits_t<_Tp>;
303  if (std::isnan(__x))
304  {
305  const auto _NaN = __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(_Real{});
306  return {__l, __m, __x, _NaN, _NaN, _NaN, __phase};
307  }
308  else if (std::abs(__x) < _Real{1})
309  {
310  // Find Q_l^0 and Q_l^1 by upward recurrence on l.
311  const auto __fact = (_Tp{1} - __x) * (_Tp{1} + __x);
312  const auto __root = std::sqrt(_Tp{1} - __x) * std::sqrt(_Tp{1} + __x);
313  const auto __log = std::log((_Tp{1} + __x) / (_Tp{1} - __x)) / _Tp{2};
314 
315  const auto _Q_00 = __log;
316  const auto _Q_01 = __phase / __root;
317  if (__l == 0)
318  {
319  if (__m == 0)
320  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_00, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
321  else if (__m == 1)
322  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_01, _Q_00, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
323  }
324 
325  const auto _Q_10 = __x * _Q_00 - _Tp{1};
326  const auto _Q_11 = __phase * __root * (__log + __x / __fact);
327  if (__l == 1)
328  {
329  if (__m == 0)
330  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_10, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
331  else if (__m == 1)
332  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_11, _Q_10, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
333  }
334 
335  auto _Q_lm20 = _Q_00;
336  auto _Q_lm10 = _Q_10;
337  auto _Q_lm21 = _Q_01;
338  auto _Q_lm11 = _Q_11;
339  auto _Q_l0 = (_Tp{3} * __x * _Q_lm10 - _Tp{1} * _Q_lm20) / _Tp{2};
340  auto _Q_l1 = (_Tp{3} * __x * _Q_lm11 - _Tp{2} * _Q_lm21);
341  for (int __k = 3; __k <= __l; ++__k)
342  {
343  _Q_lm20 = _Q_lm10;
344  _Q_lm10 = _Q_l0;
345  _Q_l0 = (_Tp(2 * __k - 1) * __x * _Q_lm10
346  - _Tp(__k - 1) * _Q_lm20) / _Tp(__k);
347 
348  _Q_lm21 = _Q_lm11;
349  _Q_lm11 = _Q_l1;
350  _Q_l1 = (_Tp(2 * __k - 1) * __x * _Q_lm11
351  - _Tp(__k) * _Q_lm21) / _Tp(__k - 1);
352  }
353  if (__m == 0)
354  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_l0, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
355  else if (__m == 1)
356  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_l1, _Q_l0, _Tp{0}, __phase}; // FIXME?
357 
358  // Find Q_l^m by upward recurrence on m.
359  auto _Q_lmm2 = _Q_l0;
360  auto _Q_lmm1 = _Q_l1;
361  auto _Q_lm = __phase * (_Tp{2} * __x * _Q_lmm1 / __root
362  + _Tp(__l + 1) * _Tp(__l) * _Q_l0);
363  for (int __k = 3; __k <= __m; ++__k)
364  {
365  _Q_lmm2 = _Q_lmm1;
366  _Q_lmm1 = _Q_lm;
367  _Q_lm = __phase * (_Tp(2 * (__k - 1)) * __x * _Q_lmm1 / __root
368  - _Tp(__l + __k - 1) * _Tp(__l - __k + 2) * _Q_l0);
369  }
370 
371  return {__l, __m, __x, _Q_lm, _Q_lmm1, _Q_lmm2, __phase};
372  }
373  else
374  { // FIXME!
375  return {__l, __m, __x, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, _Tp{0}, __phase};
376  }
377  }
378 
379  /**
380  * @brief Return the spherical associated Legendre function.
381  *
382  * The spherical associated Legendre function of @f$ l @f$, @f$ m @f$,
383  * and @f$ \theta @f$ is defined as @f$ Y_l^m(\theta,0) @f$ where
384  * @f[
385  * Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = (-1)^m[\frac{(2l+1)}{4\pi}
386  * \frac{(l-m)!}{(l+m)!}]
387  * P_l^m(\cos\theta) \exp^{im\phi}
388  * @f]
389  * is the spherical harmonic function and @f$ P_l^m(x) @f$ is the
390  * associated Legendre function.
391  *
392  * This function differs from the associated Legendre function by
393  * argument (@f$x = \cos(\theta)@f$) and by a normalization factor
394  * but this factor is rather large for large @f$ l @f$ and @f$ m @f$
395  * and so this function is stable for larger differences of @f$ l @f$
396  * and @f$ m @f$.
397  * @note Unlike the case for __assoc_legendre_p the Condon-Shortley
398  * phase factor @f$ (-1)^m @f$ is present here.
399  * @note @f$ Y_l^m(\theta) = 0 @f$ if @f$ m > l @f$.
400  *
401  * @param __l The degree of the spherical associated Legendre function.
402  * @f$ l >= 0 @f$.
403  * @param __m The order of the spherical associated Legendre function.
404  * @param __theta The radian polar angle argument
405  * of the spherical associated Legendre function.
406  */
407  template<typename _Tp>
408  _Tp
409  __sph_legendre(unsigned int __l, unsigned int __m, _Tp __theta)
410  {
411  if (std::isnan(__theta))
412  return __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(__theta);
413 
414  const auto __x = std::cos(__theta);
415 
416  if (__m > __l)
417  return _Tp{0};
418  else if (__m == 0)
419  {
420  auto _P_l = __legendre_p(__l, __x).__P_l;
421  _Tp __fact = std::sqrt(_Tp(2 * __l + 1)
422  / (_Tp{4} * __gnu_cxx::__const_pi(__theta)));
423  _P_l *= __fact;
424  return _P_l;
425  }
426  else if (__x == _Tp{1} || __x == -_Tp{1})
427  return _Tp{0}; // m > 0 here
428  else
429  {
430  // m > 0 and |x| < 1 here
431 
432  // Starting value for recursion.
433  // Y_m^m(x) = \sqrt{ (2m+1)/(4pi m) \Gamma(m+1/2)/\Gamma(m) }
434  // (-1)^m (1-x^2)^(m/2) / \pi^(1/4)
435  const auto __sgn = (__m % 2 == 1 ? -_Tp{1} : _Tp{1});
436  const auto _Y_mp1m_factor = __x * std::sqrt(_Tp(2 * __m + 3));
437  const auto __lncirc = std::log1p(-__x * __x);
438  // Gamma(m+1/2) / Gamma(m)
439  const auto __lnpoch = __log_gamma(_Tp(__m + 0.5L))
440  - __log_gamma(_Tp(__m));
441  const auto __lnpre_val =
442  -_Tp{0.25L} * __gnu_cxx::__const_ln_pi(__theta)
443  + _Tp{0.5L} * (__lnpoch + __m * __lncirc);
444  const auto __sr = std::sqrt((_Tp{2} + _Tp{1} / __m)
445  / (_Tp{4} * __gnu_cxx::__const_pi(__theta)));
446  auto _Y_mm = __sgn * __sr * std::exp(__lnpre_val);
447  auto _Y_mp1m = _Y_mp1m_factor * _Y_mm;
448 
449  if (__l == __m)
450  return _Y_mm;
451  else if (__l == __m + 1)
452  return _Y_mp1m;
453  else
454  {
455  auto _Y_lm = _Tp{0};
456 
457  // Compute Y_l^m, l > m+1, upward recursion on l.
458  for (int __ll = __m + 2; __ll <= __l; ++__ll)
459  {
460  const auto __rat1 = _Tp(__ll - __m) / _Tp(__ll + __m);
461  const auto __rat2 = _Tp(__ll - __m - 1) / _Tp(__ll + __m - 1);
462  const auto __fact1 = std::sqrt(__rat1 * _Tp(2 * __ll + 1)
463  * _Tp(2 * __ll - 1));
464  const auto __fact2 = std::sqrt(__rat1 * __rat2
465  * _Tp(2 * __ll + 1)
466  / _Tp(2 * __ll - 3));
467  _Y_lm = (__x * _Y_mp1m * __fact1
468  - _Tp(__ll + __m - 1) * _Y_mm * __fact2)
469  / _Tp(__ll - __m);
470  _Y_mm = _Y_mp1m;
471  _Y_mp1m = _Y_lm;
472  }
473 
474  return _Y_lm;
475  }
476  }
477  }
478 
479 
480  /**
481  * @brief Return the spherical harmonic function.
482  *
483  * The spherical harmonic function of @f$ l @f$, @f$ m @f$,
484  * and @f$ \theta @f$, @f$ \phi @f$ is defined by:
485  * @f[
486  * Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = (-1)^m[\frac{(2l+1)}{4\pi}
487  * \frac{(l-m)!}{(l+m)!}]
488  * P_l^{|m|}(\cos\theta) \exp^{im\phi}
489  * @f]
490  * @note @f$ Y_l^m(\theta,\phi) = 0 @f$ if @f$ |m| > l @f$.
491  *
492  * @param __l The degree of the spherical harmonic function.
493  * @f$ l >= 0 @f$.
494  * @param __m The order of the spherical harmonic function.
495  * @param __theta The radian polar angle argument
496  * of the spherical harmonic function.
497  * @param __phi The radian azimuthal angle argument
498  * of the spherical harmonic function.
499  */
500  template<typename _Tp>
501  std::complex<_Tp>
502  __sph_harmonic(unsigned int __l, int __m, _Tp __theta, _Tp __phi)
503  {
504  const auto _S_NaN = __gnu_cxx::__quiet_NaN(__theta);
505  if (std::isnan(__theta) || std::isnan(__phi))
506  return std::complex<_Tp>{_S_NaN, _S_NaN};
507  else if (std::abs(__m) > __l)
508  return std::complex<_Tp>{0, 0};
509  else
510  return __sph_legendre(__l, std::abs(__m), __theta)
511  * std::polar(_Tp{1}, _Tp(__m) * __phi);
512  }
513 
514 
515  /**
516  * Build a list of zeros and weights for the Gauss-Legendre integration rule
517  * for the Legendre polynomial of degree @c l.
518  */
519  template<typename _Tp>
520  std::vector<__gnu_cxx::__quadrature_point_t<_Tp>>
521  __legendre_zeros(unsigned int __l, _Tp proto = _Tp{})
522  {
523  const auto _S_eps = __gnu_cxx::__epsilon(proto);
524  const auto _S_pi = __gnu_cxx::__const_pi(proto);
525  const unsigned int _S_maxit = 1000u;
526 
527  std::vector<__gnu_cxx::__quadrature_point_t<_Tp>> __pt(__l);
528 
529  auto __m = __l / 2;
530 
531  // Treat the central zero for odd degree specially.
532  // Be careful to avoid overflow of the factorials.
533  // An alternative would be to proceed with the recursion
534  // for large degree.
535  if (__l & 1)
536  {
537  const auto __lm = __l - 1;
538  const auto __mm = __lm / 2;
539  auto _Am = _Tp{1};
540  for (auto __m = 1u; __m <= __mm; ++__m)
541  _Am *= -_Tp(2 * __m - 1) / _Tp(2 * __m);
542  auto __Plm1 = _Am;
543  auto __Ppl = __l * __Plm1;
544  __pt[__m].__point = _Tp{0};
545  __pt[__m].__weight = _Tp{2} / __Ppl / __Ppl;
546  }
547 
548  for (auto __i = 1u; __i <= __m; ++__i)
549  {
550  // Clever approximation of root.
551  auto __z = std::cos(_S_pi * (__i - _Tp{1} / _Tp{4})
552  / (__l + _Tp{1} / _Tp{2}));
553  auto __z1 = __z;
554  auto __w = _Tp{0};
555  for (auto __its = 0u; __its < _S_maxit; ++__its)
556  {
557  // Compute __P, __P1, and __P2 the Legendre polynomials of degree
558  // l, l-1, l-2 respectively by iterating through the recursion
559  // relation for the Legendre polynomials.
560  // Compute __Pp the derivative of the Legendre polynomial
561  // of degree l.
562  auto __P1 = _Tp{0};
563  auto __P = _Tp{1};
564  for (auto __k = 1u; __k <= __l; ++__k)
565  {
566  auto __P2 = __P1;
567  __P1 = __P;
568  // Recursion for Legendre polynomials.
569  __P = ((_Tp{2} * __k - _Tp{1}) * __z * __P1
570  - (__k - _Tp{1}) * __P2) / __k;
571  }
572  // Recursion for the derivative of The Legendre polynomial.
573  auto __Pp = __l * (__z * __P - __P1) / (__z * __z - _Tp{1});
574  __z1 = __z;
575  // Converge on root by Newton's method.
576  __z = __z1 - __P / __Pp;
577  if (std::abs(__z - __z1) < _S_eps)
578  {
579  __w = _Tp{2} / ((_Tp{1} - __z * __z) * __Pp * __Pp);
580  break;
581  }
582  if (__its > _S_maxit)
583  std::__throw_logic_error("__legendre_zeros: "
584  "Too many iterations");
585  }
586 
587  __pt[__i - 1].__point = -__z;
588  __pt[__l - __i].__point = __z;
589  __pt[__i - 1].__weight = __w;
590  __pt[__l - __i].__weight = __w;
591  }
592 
593  return __pt;
594  }
595 } // namespace __detail
596 
597 _GLIBCXX_END_NAMESPACE_VERSION
598 } // namespace std
599 
600 #endif // _GLIBCXX_BITS_SF_LEGENDRE_TCC
